content.raw:
Interesting change, the [cpplint](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/src/c7bc315dd2b49617621847c6a63e8a81825d6cbb/tools/cpplint.py?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) on `ign-gui` has been telling me to do exactly the opposite and put c headers first. If I copy that cpplint here, I get a bunch of warnings, one of them being:

`./include/sdf/parser_private.hh:22:  Found C system header after C++ system header. Should be: parser_private.h, c system, c++ system, other.  [build/include_order] [4]`

I have no opinion on what way is best, but I think that as we start multiplying the number of projects we host, this is the kind of thing we should standardize in a place like [ign-seed](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-seed).

./include/sdf/parser_private.hh:22: Found C system header after C++ system header. Should be: parser_private.h, c system, c++ system, other. [build/include_order] [4]

I have no opinion on what way is best, but I think that as we start multiplying the number of projects we host, this is the kind of thing we should standardize in a place like ign-seed.
